snippet.textDisplay: I played through this game for the first time this summer and... what an amazing game. I had recently played Dark Souls 3 and I definitely felt like my FromSoftware reflexes were on point. I needed some time to get used to having no shield and exploit the parry mechanic, so I had a lot of trouble going through the starting zone. And then, it clicked. I ended up being stuck on only a few bosses, and even those it was usually 4-5 attempts. I read a lot of people saying they find Bloodborne harder than the Dark Souls series, but it was absolutely the opposite for me (and that's fine). A lot of it comes from having so many healing vials, as well as the Rally mechanic which lets you heal per hit within 5 seconds of being hit yourself. That mechanic is so great that I now wish all games in this genre had it, because it makes combat even more intense with its risk/reward.  I actually beat Gehrman on my 2nd attempt, and then proceeded to beat Moon Presence on the first try. The Orphan of Kos was definitely a big challenge though.
snippet.textOriginal: I played through this game for the first time this summer and... what an amazing game. I had recently played Dark Souls 3 and I definitely felt like my FromSoftware reflexes were on point. I needed some time to get used to having no shield and exploit the parry mechanic, so I had a lot of trouble going through the starting zone. And then, it clicked. I ended up being stuck on only a few bosses, and even those it was usually 4-5 attempts. I read a lot of people saying they find Bloodborne harder than the Dark Souls series, but it was absolutely the opposite for me (and that's fine). A lot of it comes from having so many healing vials, as well as the Rally mechanic which lets you heal per hit within 5 seconds of being hit yourself. That mechanic is so great that I now wish all games in this genre had it, because it makes combat even more intense with its risk/reward.  I actually beat Gehrman on my 2nd attempt, and then proceeded to beat Moon Presence on the first try. The Orphan of Kos was definitely a big challenge though.

snippet.textDisplay: I think you need some more Bloodborne on this list...
snippet.textOriginal: I think you need some more Bloodborne on this list...

snippet.textDisplay: Ironically I beat Kos on my first try but that's because I saw my brother rage and he couldn't beat it for like an hour strait before. I never fought this boss because I wanted to finish all of the DLC first(didn't want to newgame yet and didn't know it wasn't the end end boss) and took like 3 weeks trying to beat this DLC dog + greatsword boss my brother had beaten in like 2 tries lmfao. Eventually I went in with 2 npc summons and whooped it but then after doing 8 hours of chalice dungeons I had to give game back to friend.

Eventually I went in with 2 npc summons and whooped it but then after doing 8 hours of chalice dungeons I had to give game back to friend.

snippet.textDisplay: Orphan of Kos is a bitch holy crap, stuck on it and haven't beaten the game because im only missing him and moon presence

snippet.textDisplay: Weird, I mostly hear people calling Bloodborne the easiest of the Soulsborne + Sekiro games.
snippet.textOriginal: Weird, I mostly hear people calling Bloodborne the easiest of the Soulsborne + Sekiro games.

snippet.textDisplay: @Recht_voor_zijn_raap When I played through it the first time I got summoned into another guys game. We got the whole there with pretty decent teamwork. The three of us were doing well till phase II hit. Even with trading hate at about the best times possible we all ran out of vials and ended up wiped out. I was drenched in sweat by the time we lost. I can't remember any other boss raising my temperature nearly as much as him. I was on NG+4 for it. That lightning attack is takes some getting used to.
snippet.textOriginal: @Recht_voor_zijn_raap When I played through it the first time I got summoned into another guys game. We got the whole there with pretty decent teamwork. The three of us were doing well till phase II hit. Even with trading hate at about the best times possible we all ran out of vials and ended up wiped out. I was drenched in sweat by the time we lost. I can't remember any other boss raising my temperature nearly as much as him. I was on NG+4 for it. That lightning attack is takes some getting used to.

snippet.textDisplay: There are so many GREAT themes in Bloodborne. It may be one of my favourite soundtracks ever because it hits all my notes. Dark and brooding orchestral sounds, and lots of cello lol. This is probably one of my favourite themes in the game, along with Ludwig, Lady Maria, and Ebrietas.

snippet.textDisplay:
An absolute masterpiece, easily one of the best games ever made.
Add to this a legendary soundtrack and this is one for the ages.

Thank you FROM Software.
